elseif CharacterName=="Drulgo" then disableTrigger("EatDrinkNotThief") mazecommand="assist" theRing="sapphirering" enableTrigger("DwarvenStatue") disableTrigger("lootRohirrim") disableTrigger("AutoLloot") end --echotest(CharacterName) --echotest(CharacterName) --echotest(CharacterName) gh_skeleton=1 mercenary=0

Trigger.name: night vision : Your night vision is refreshed.
night vision : Your vision blurs.
Trigger.script:
local night_vision = spell_timer.get_timer("night_vision")
night_vision.stop_time = time_get_time() night_vision.last_elapsed_time = night_vision.elapsed_time night_vision.elapsed_time = night_vision.stop_time - night_vision.start_time
local time = time.convert_seconds_to_hms(night_vision.elapsed_time) echo("\nThe spell lasted " .. time .. ".\n")

Trigger.name: night vision : - night vision
Trigger.script:
local night_vision = spell_timer.get_timer("night_vision")
if night_vision.start_time == 0 then night_vision.start_time = time_get_time() end
night_vision.elapsed_time = time_get_time() - night_vision.start_time
local time_str = time.convert_seconds_to_hms(night_vision.elapsed_time)
local append = "" if night_vision.last_elapsed_time == nil then night_vision.last_elapsed_time = 0 end if night_vision.last_elapsed_time ~= 0 then local percent = math.floor(night_vision.elapsed_time / night_vision.last_elapsed_time * 100) local time_to_go = time.convert_seconds_to_hms(night_vision.last_elapsed_time - night_vision.elapsed_time) append = "<grey>/<" .. spell_timer.colour .. ">" .. time_to_go .. "<grey>/<" .. spell_timer.colour .. ">" .. percent .. "%<grey>" end
selectString(matches[1], 1) replace("") cinsertText(matches[1] .. " (<" .. spell_timer.colour .. ">" .. time_str .. append .. "<grey>)")

Trigger.name: Display XP/TP Gained
Trigger.script:
-- Remove any commas from the xp stat_tracker.current_xp = string.gsub(matches[2], ",", "")
if stat_tracker.last_xp then -- Get the difference in experience local difference = stat_tracker.current_xp - stat_tracker.last_xp
stat_tracker.session_xp = stat_tracker.session_xp + difference
if difference ~= 0 then cecho("\n<cyan><yellow>You gained " .. difference .. " xp.") end end
-- Save the current xp as the last xp stat_tracker.last_xp = stat_tracker.current_xp
-- Remove any commas from the tp stat_tracker.current_tp = string.gsub(matches[3], ",", "")
if stat_tracker.last_tp then -- Get the difference in travel points local difference = stat_tracker.current_tp - stat_tracker.last_tp
stat_tracker.session_tp = stat_tracker.session_tp + difference
if difference ~= 0 then cecho("\<cyan><yellow>You gained " .. difference .. " tp.") end end
-- Save the current tp as the last tp stat_tracker.last_tp = stat_tracker.current_tp

Trigger.name: Set Start MUME Moment (Time Part)
Trigger.script:
echo("\nYou set your clock") --(.*)$ clock_is_set = true
-- Store the curret MUME time for the time part of the start MUME moment clock_start_mume_moment = {} clock_start_mume_moment.hour = matches[2] clock_start_mume_moment.minute = matches[3] clock_start_mume_moment.period = matches[4] clock_start_mume_moment.epoch = time_get_time() clock_start_time = clock_start_mume_moment.epoch
echo(clock_start_mume_moment.hour) echo(clock_start_mume_moment.minute) echo(clock_start_mume_moment.period)
-- Store the current time as UNIX epoch
enableTrigger("Set Start MUME Moment (Date Part)") send("time", false)
clock_adjust_timer(clock_start_mume_moment.minute) --table.save("/tmp/clock_start_mume_moment", clock_start_mume_moment) writeMoment() send("createtimedatatable")

Trigger.name: Set Start MUME Moment (Date Part)
Trigger.script:

-- Convert start MUME moment to MUME time since the beginning clock_start_mume_time = clock_convert_mume_moment_to_mume_time(clock_start_mume_moment) echo("\\\\\\\\") echo(clock_start_mume_time) echo("\\\\\\\\") disableTrigger("Set Start MUME Moment (Date Part)")

Trigger.name: Eg_armour
Trigger.script:
local Eg_armour = spell_timer.get_timer("Eg_armour")
if Eg_armour.start_time == 0 then Eg_armour.start_time = time_get_time() end
Eg_armour.elapsed_time = time_get_time() - Eg_armour.start_time
local time_str = time.convert_seconds_to_hms(Eg_armour.elapsed_time)
local append = "" if Eg_armour.last_elapsed_time == nil then Eg_armour.last_elapsed_time = 0 end if Eg_armour.last_elapsed_time ~= 0 then local percent = math.floor(Eg_armour.elapsed_time / Eg_armour.last_elapsed_time * 100) local time_to_go = time.convert_seconds_to_hms(Eg_armour.last_elapsed_time - Eg_armour.elapsed_time) append = "<grey>/<" .. spell_timer.colour .. ">" .. time_to_go .. "<grey>/<" .. spell_timer.colour .. ">" .. percent .. "%<grey>" end selectString(matches[1], 1) replace("") cinsertText(matches[1] .. " (<" .. spell_timer.colour .. ">" .. time_str .. append .. "<grey>)")

Trigger.name: Detect Line Editor
Trigger.script:
edit.editing = true
-- Build the filename out of the date and description edit.filename = getTime(true, "yyyy.MM.dd HH.mm.ss") .. " - " .. edit.description .. ".txt"
-- Fix filename edit.filename = string.gsub(edit.filename, ":", "-")
-- Build the full path to the text file edit.filename_fullpath = edit.options.folder .. "/" .. edit.filename
-- Put the old text into the file local file = io.open(edit.filename_fullpath, "w") io.output(file) for index, line in ipairs(edit.lines) do io.write(line .. "\n") end io.close(file)
echo("\nEditing local file " .. edit.filename .. ".\n") echo("Mudlet will send MUME your text when you finish editing.\n")
-- Run the local editor program and open the file local command = "\"" .. edit.options.editor .. "\" \"" .. edit.filename_fullpath .. "\"" edit.process = spawn(display, command) enableTimer("Edit: Check Process Closed")

Trigger.name: Detect Old Text
Trigger.script:
enableTrigger("Edit: Capture Line")
-- Two lines above the "---" line is the description edit.description = getLines(getLineNumber() - 2, getLineNumber() - 1)[1]

Trigger.name: Edit: Capture Line
Trigger.script: -- Capture the old text (stuff between "---" and "==>") if line ~= "==>" and line ~= "-------------------------------------------------------------------------------" then table.insert(edit.lines, matches[1]) end

Timer.name: Edit: Check Process Closed
Timer.script:
-- When the editor closes... if not edit.process.isRunning() then enableTrigger("Hide Blank Lines") enableTrigger("Hide Done!")
echo("Deleting old message...\n") for index, line in ipairs(edit.lines) do send("%d", false) end
local lines = {} for line in io.lines(edit.filename_fullpath) do table.insert(lines, line) end if edit.options.enable_wrap then lines = edit.wrap(lines) end
echo("Sending new message...\n") for index, line in ipairs(lines) do if line == "" then send("\n") else send(line) end end
-- Close the line editor send("%e", false)
-- Clear the old message edit.lines = {}
disableTimer("Edit: Check Process Closed")
edit.editing = false end

Alias.name: examine
Alias.script:
function ExamineWhat(myobject,myobject2,character) if string.char(string.byte(matches[2],2))=="" then send ("look in 1."..myobject) elseif string.char(string.byte(matches[2],2))==character then send("look in "..myobject2) elseif tonumber(string.len(matches[2]))~=nil then send("look in "..string.char(string.byte(matches[2],2)).."."..myobject) end end
if --examine string.len(matches[2])==0 then send("examine") elseif--examine <object> string.char(string.byte(matches[2]))==" " then send("examine"..matches[2])
elseif--examine N.pouch string.char(string.byte(matches[2]))=="s" then ExamineWhat("pouch")
elseif--examine N.backpack/pipe string.char(string.byte(matches[2]))=="p" then -- ExamineWhat("satchel","pipe","p") ExamineWhat("pack","pipe","p")
elseif--examine N.quiver string.char(string.byte(matches[2]))=="q" then ExamineWhat("quiver")
elseif--examine N.corpse string.char(string.byte(matches[2]))=="c" then ExamineWhat("corpse")
elseif--examin N.lantern string.char(string.byte(matches[2]))=="l" then ExamineWhat("lantern")
elseif--examin N.keyring string.char(string.byte(matches[2]))=="k" then ExamineWhat("keyring") -- end end

Script.name: deleteOldProfiles
Script.script:
function deleteOldProfiles(keepdays_arg, delete_maps)
--[[ Deletes old profiles/maps in the "current"/"map" folders of the Mudlet home directory. The following files are NOT deleted: - Files newer than the amount of days specified as an argument to deleteOldProfiles(), or 31 days if not specified. - One file for every month before that. Specifically: The first available file of every month prior to this. Setting the second argument to true will delete maps instead of profiles. (e.g. deleteOldProfiles(10, true)) --]]
local keepdays = tonumber(keepdays_arg) or 31 local profile_table = {} local used_last_mod_months = {} local slash = (string.char(getMudletHomeDir():byte()) == "/") and "/" or "\\" local dirpath = getMudletHomeDir()..slash..(delete_maps and "map" or "current") local delnum = 0
-- Traverse the profiles folder and create a table of files: for filename in lfs.dir(dirpath) do if filename~="." and filename~=".." then profile_table[#profile_table+1] = {name = filename, last_mod = lfs.attributes(dirpath..slash..filename, "modification")} end end
-- Sort the table according to last modification date from old to new: table.sort(profile_table, function (a,b) return a.last_mod < b.last_mod end)
echo(string.format("\nDeleting old %s. Files newer than %d days and one profile for every month before that will be kept.", delete_maps and "maps" or "profiles", keepdays)) for i,v in ipairs(profile_table) do local days = math.floor(os.difftime(os.time(), v.last_mod)/86400) local last_mod_month = os.date("%Y/%m", v.last_mod) if days > keepdays then -- For profiles older than X days, check if we already kept a table for this month: if not table.contains(used_last_mod_months, last_mod_month) then -- If not, do nothing and mark this month as "kept". used_last_mod_months[#used_last_mod_months+1] = last_mod_month else -- Otherwise remove the file: local success, errorstring = os.remove(dirpath..slash..v.name) if success then delnum = delnum + 1 else cecho("\n<red>ERROR: "..errorstring) end end end end echo(string.format("\nDeletion complete. %d/%d files were removed successfully.", delnum, #profile_table)) end

Script.script:
group.help = [[ Group Author: Octavia Version: 1.0 Changelog: - 1.0, 2015-2-10 - Initial release.
This package contains very basic functionality for operating in a group as a leader and as a follower. With this package, when you raise your hand you disband your group. This can be disabled under Triggers in the Script Editor. Also with this package, if you follow someone they will be set internally as the leader, and you will automatically lead/ride when the leader leads/rides. Final this package supports automatically grouping people who raise their hands.
The commands are as follows: - group help : Show this message. - autogroup on : Allow people to add themselves to your group by raising their hand. - autogroup off : Disable autogroup. ]]

Script.name: README
Script.script:
spell_timer.help = [[ Spell Timer Author: Octavia Thanks: - nstockton for most of the spell messages - p(Cahal) for testing Version: 1.0 Changelog: - 1.0, 2015-2-11 - Initial release.
This package tracks the duration of various status effects from spells. When you use stat, the package will display for each spell effect, the time since the spell was cast or refreshed. If the spell ends, that time is remembered and stat will then show the time remaining and percent complete of the spell if it is cast again.
The commands are as follows: - spell timer help : Show this message. - spell timer make triggers : Recreates the triggers under Spell Timer. This should not be necessary to use.
Dependencies (included): - Time ]]

Script.name: spells
make_triggers
Script.script:
function spell_timer.make_triggers() local code
-- For each spell for name, spell in pairs(spell_timer.spells) do -- Create the trigger to start timer code = spell_timer.get_trigger_start_code(spell) spell_timer.make_trigger(name, spell.start, code)
-- Create the trigger to refresh timer if spell.refresh ~= "" then code = spell_timer.get_trigger_start_code(spell) spell_timer.make_trigger(name, spell.refresh, code) end
-- Create the trigger to stop timer code = spell_timer.get_trigger_stop_code(spell) spell_timer.make_trigger(name, spell.stop, code)
-- Create the trigger to show timer (status) code = spell_timer.get_trigger_show_code(spell) local show = "- " .. name spell_timer.make_trigger(name, show, code) end end

if exists(name, "trigger") == 0 then permRegexTrigger(name, parent, { regex }, code) else echo("Spell Timer: Error: Already exists: " .. name .. ".\n") end end

if <NAME>.start_time == 0 then <NAME>.start_time = time_get_time() end
<NAME>.elapsed_time = time_get_time() - <NAME>.start_time
local time_str = time.convert_seconds_to_hms(<NAME>.elapsed_time)
local append = "" if <NAME>.last_elapsed_time == nil then <NAME>.last_elapsed_time = 0 end if <NAME>.last_elapsed_time ~= 0 then local percent = math.floor(<NAME>.elapsed_time / <NAME>.last_elapsed_time * 100) local time_to_go = time.convert_seconds_to_hms(<NAME>.last_elapsed_time - <NAME>.elapsed_time) append = "<grey>/<" .. spell_timer.colour .. ">" .. time_to_go .. "<grey>/<" .. spell_timer.colour .. ">" .. percent .. "%<grey>" end
selectString(matches[1], 1) replace("") cinsertText(matches[1] .. " (<" .. spell_timer.colour .. ">" .. time_str .. append .. "<grey>)") ]] code = string.gsub(code, "<NAME>", spell.name) return code end

function spell_timer.get_timer(name) if not spell_timer.timers[name] then local timer = {} timer.start_time = 0 timer.stop_time = 0 timer.elapsed_time = 0 timer.last_elapsed_time = 0
spell_timer.timers[name] = timer end
return spell_timer.timers[name] end

Script.name: truncate
convert_mume_moment_to_mume_time
Script.script:
function clock_convert_mume_moment_to_mume_time(mume_moment) -- Calculate years since the start of MUME time local years_since = mume_moment.year - clock_mume_start_year
-- Convert year to MUME minutes local year_as_mume_minutes = years_since * clock_minutes_per_year
-- Convert month to MUME minutes local month_as_mume_minutes = (mume_moment.month - 1) * clock_minutes_per_month
-- Convert day to MUME minutes local day_as_mume_minutes = (mume_moment.day - 1) * clock_minutes_per_day
-- Convert time to MUME minutes local time_as_mume_minutes = clock_convert_mume_time_to_mume_minutes(mume_moment.hour, mume_moment.minute, mume_moment.period)
return year_as_mume_minutes + month_as_mume_minutes + day_as_mume_minutes + time_as_mume_minutes end

Script.name: convert_mume_time_to_mume_minutes
Script.script:
function clock_convert_mume_time_to_mume_minutes(hour, minute, period) -- Convert hour to 24-hour local hour24 = 0 if period == "am" then hour24 = hour % 12 elseif period == "pm" then hour24 = hour % 12 + 12 end
return hour24 * clock_minutes_per_hour + minute end

Script.name: convert_mume_time_to_mume_moment
Script.script:
function clock_convert_mume_time_to_mume_moment(mume_time) local mume_moment = {}
-- Year local mume_time_in_years = math.floor(mume_time / clock_minutes_per_year) mume_moment.year = clock_mume_start_year + mume_time_in_years
-- Month local mume_time_wo_years = mume_time - mume_time_in_years * clock_minutes_per_year mume_moment.month = math.floor(mume_time_wo_years / clock_minutes_per_month) + 1
-- Day local mume_time_wo_years_months = mume_time_wo_years - (mume_moment.month - 1) * clock_minutes_per_month mume_moment.day = math.floor(mume_time_wo_years_months / clock_minutes_per_day) + 1
-- Hour and period local mume_time_wo_years_months_days = mume_time_wo_years_months - (mume_moment.day - 1) * clock_minutes_per_day local hour24 = math.floor(mume_time_wo_years_months_days / clock_minutes_per_hour)
if hour24 == 0 then mume_moment.hour = 12 mume_moment.period = "am" elseif hour24 == 12 then mume_moment.hour = 12 mume_moment.period = "pm" elseif hour24 > 12 then mume_moment.hour = hour24 - 12 mume_moment.period = "pm" else mume_moment.hour = hour24 mume_moment.period = "am" end
-- Minute mume_moment.minute = mume_time_wo_years_months_days - hour24 * clock_minutes_per_hour
return mume_moment end

Script.name: get_mume_moment
Script.script:
function clock_get_mume_moment() if not clock_is_set then table.load("/tmp/clock_start_mume_moment", clock_start_mume_moment) clock_start_time = clock_start_mume_moment.epoch end
-- Get the number of real seconds since the clock was set local elapsed_seconds = time_get_time() - clock_start_time
-- Add the elapsed seconds to the start MUME time as MUME minutes local mume_time = clock_start_mume_time + elapsed_seconds
-- Convert MUME time to MUME moment local mume_moment = clock_convert_mume_time_to_mume_moment(mume_time)
return mume_moment end

Script.name: convert_mume_time_to_mume_minutes
Script.script:
function clock_convert_mume_time_to_mume_minutes(hour, minute, period) -- Convert hour to 24-hour local hour24 if period == "pm" then if hour == 12 then hour24 = 12 else hour24 = hour + 12 end elseif period == "am" then if hour == 12 then hour24 = 0 else hour24 = hour end end
return hour24 * clock_minutes_per_hour + minute end

Script.name: convert_month_name_to_month_number
Script.script:
function clock_convert_month_name_to_month_number(name) local number = clock_westron_month_numbers[name]
if number == nil then number = clock_sindarin_month_numbers[name] clock_use_westron_calendar = false else clock_use_westron_calendar = true end
return number end

Script.name: convert_month_number_to_month_name
Script.script:
function clock_convert_month_number_to_month_name(number) if clock_use_westron_calendar then return clock_westron_month_names[number] end
return clock_sindarin_month_names[number] end

Script.name: is_last_day_of_month
Script.script: function clock_is_last_day_of_month(mume_moment) return mume_moment.day == clock_days_per_month -- return mume_moment.day = clock_days_per_month end

Script.name: get_dawn
Script.script:
function clock_get_dawn(mume_moment) local month = clock_get_effective_month(mume_moment)
return clock_dawn[month] end

Script.name: get_dusk
Script.script:
function clock_get_dusk(mume_moment) local month = clock_get_effective_month(mume_moment)
return clock_dusk[month] end

Script.name: get_time_to_dawn
Script.script:
function clock_get_time_to_dawn(mume_moment) local minutes_since_12am = clock_convert_mume_time_to_mume_minutes(mume_moment.hour, mume_moment.minute, mume_moment.period) local month = clock_get_effective_month(mume_moment) local dawn = clock_dawn_as_minutes[month]
if clock_dawn_passed(mume_moment) then dawn = dawn + clock_hours_per_day * clock_minutes_per_hour end
local time_to_dawn = dawn - minutes_since_12am
return time.convert_seconds_to_hms(time_to_dawn) end

Script.name: get_time_to_dusk
Script.script:
function clock_get_time_to_dusk(mume_moment) local minutes_since_12am = clock_convert_mume_time_to_mume_minutes(mume_moment.hour, mume_moment.minute, mume_moment.period) local month = clock_get_effective_month(mume_moment) local dusk = clock_dusk_as_minutes[month]
if clock_dusk_passed(mume_moment) then dusk = dusk + clock_hours_per_day * clock_minutes_per_hour end
local time_to_dusk = dusk - minutes_since_12am
return time.convert_seconds_to_hms(time_to_dusk) end

Script.name: dawn_passed
Script.script:
function clock_dawn_passed(mume_moment) local minutes_since_12am = clock_convert_mume_time_to_mume_minutes(mume_moment.hour, mume_moment.minute, mume_moment.period) local dawn_in_minutes = clock_dawn_as_minutes[mume_moment.month]
return minutes_since_12am > dawn_in_minutes end

Script.name: dusk_passed
Script.script:
function clock_dusk_passed(mume_moment) local minutes_since_12am = clock_convert_mume_time_to_mume_minutes(mume_moment.hour, mume_moment.minute, mume_moment.period) local dusk_in_minutes = clock_dusk_as_minutes[mume_moment.month]
return minutes_since_12am > dusk_in_minutes end

Script.name: get_effective_month
Script.script:
function clock_get_effective_month(mume_moment) local month = mume_moment.month
if clock_dawn_passed(mume_moment) and clock_is_last_day_of_month(mume_moment) then month = (month + 1) % 12 end
return month end

Script.name: Season Data
get_season
get_month_of_season
display_time
Script.script:
function clock_display_time(mume_moment, use_color) if not clock_is_set then return "Your clock is not set." end
local highlight = "" local grey = ""--" <cyan>" if use_color then highlight = clock_get_highlight() grey = "<cyan>" end
local month_name = clock_convert_month_number_to_month_name(mume_moment.month) local dawn = clock_get_dawn(mume_moment) local dusk = clock_get_dusk(mume_moment) local time_to_dawn = clock_get_time_to_dawn(mume_moment) local time_to_dusk = clock_get_time_to_dusk(mume_moment)
local padded_minute = mume_moment.minute if padded_minute < 10 then padded_minute = "0" .. padded_minute end
local result = "Time: " .. highlight .. mume_moment.hour .. ":" .. padded_minute .. " " .. mume_moment.period .. grey .. "." result = result .. " Dawn: " .. highlight .. dawn .. grey .. " (" .. highlight .. time_to_dawn .. grey .. ")." result = result .. " Dusk: " .. highlight .. dusk .. grey .. " (" .. highlight .. time_to_dusk .. grey .. ")."
return result end

Script.name: display_date
Script.script:
function clock_display_date(mume_moment, use_color) if not clock_is_set then return "Your clock is not set." end
local highlight = "" local grey = "" if use_color then highlight = clock_get_highlight() grey = "cyan" end
local month_name = clock_convert_month_number_to_month_name(mume_moment.month) local season = clock_get_season(mume_moment) local month_of_season = clock_get_month_of_season(mume_moment)
--local result = "Date: " .. highlight .. mume_moment.year .. "-" .. mume_moment.month .. "-" .. mume_moment.day .. grey .. "." -- local result = "The " .. highlight .. month_of_season .. grey .. " month of " .. highlight .. season .. grey local result = " " ..highlight .. season .. grey .." " ..highlight .. month_of_season .. grey return result end

Script.name: display_timer
Script.script:
function clock_display_timer(mume_moment) if clock_options_show_time then cecho(clock_display_time(mume_moment, true) .. "\n") end
if clock_options_show_date and mume_moment.hour == 12 and mume_moment.period == "am" then cecho(clock_display_date(mume_moment, true) .. "\n") end end

Script.name: adjust_timer
Script.script: function clock_adjust_timer(minute) -- Enable the timer to show the time and date, but offset it so it appears on the hour if minute ~= 0 then local time_offset = 60 - minute local timer = tempTimer(time_offset, [[ local mume_moment = clock_get_mume_moment() clock_display_timer(mume_moment) enableTimer("Display Time and Date") ]]) enableTimer(timer) end end

Script.name: get_highlight
README
Script.script:
clock_help = [[ Clock: Advanced MUME Time
This script tracks the MUME time as well as the MUME date, allowing it to report, in addition to the current time, the dawn and dusk times, the real time to dawn and dusk, the date, and the season. In addition, the clock will optionally let you know every time a minute has passed and keep you informed as to the date and season every 24 minutes.
To use this script, simply look at any clock in game. You can then check the time with either 'cc' (check clock) or 'ct' (check time). You may change these aliases as needed in Script Editor > Aliases > clock_
The commands are as follows: - clock help : Show this message. - cc : Check clock_ - ct : Check time. Same as check clock_ - cd : Check the date and season. - stime : Say the time out loud. - ntime : Narrate the time. - ttime <player> : Tell the time to another player. - sdate : Say the date out loud. - ndate : Narrate the date. - tdate : Tell the date to another player. - uclock : Unset the clock_ - clock show time : Toggle whether to display the time every MUME hour (1 minute). - clock show date : Toggle whether to display the date every MUME day (24 minutes). - clock set highlight : Set the highlight color for data. Use "grey" for no highlight. - clock show colours : Display a list of colours for use with the highlight option.
Changelog: - 1.3, 2015-2-12 - Added aliases to say date, narrate date, and tell date to another player. - 1.2, 2015-2-10 - Automatic loading/saving of clock data. May you never have to look at another clock again! - 1.1, 2015-2-7 - Improved the way options are set. - 1.0, 2015-2-3 - Initial release.
Dependencies: - Time - Packages
Author: Octavia ]]

Script.name: Constants
Script.script:
clock_mume_start_year = 2850
clock_months_per_year = 12
clock_days_per_month = 30 clock_days_per_year = clock_days_per_month * clock_months_per_year
clock_hours_per_day = 24
clock_minutes_per_hour = 60 clock_minutes_per_year = clock_days_per_year * clock_hours_per_day * clock_minutes_per_hour clock_minutes_per_month = clock_days_per_month * clock_hours_per_day * clock_minutes_per_hour clock_minutes_per_day = clock_hours_per_day * clock_minutes_per_hour

Script.script: function clock_initialize() clock_options_show_time = true clock_options_show_date = true clock_options_highlight = "cyan" end

if clock_is_set then cecho("
<cyan>"..text..clock_display_date(mume_moment, false).."
") else echo(text.."
") end end

Script.name: README
Script.script:
stat_tracker.help = [[ Stat Tracker Author: Octavia Version: 1.1 Changelog: - 1.1, 2015-2-11 - Fixed bug causing the xps not to work. - 1.0, 2015-2-10 - Initial release.
This package tracks the amount of xp and tp you have gained (or lost!) in a certain period of time (usually the entire session) and reports how much xp and tp you have gained total, per minute, and per hour. In addition, this script will also display the amount of xp gained after killing something or losing a level.
The commands are as follows: - stat tracker help : Show this message. - rst : Reset Stat Tracker (as if you were starting the session over). - xp : Show the amount of xp and tp needed to level. - xps : Show the amount of xp and tp gained this session total, per minute, and per hour. - rxps : Report (by say) the output xps. ]]

Script.name: reset
Script.script:
function stat_tracker.reset() stat_tracker.session_xp = 0 stat_tracker.session_tp = 0 stat_tracker.last_xp = nil stat_tracker.last_tp = nil stat_tracker.start_time = time_get_time()
expandAlias("exp", false) end

Script.name: make_time_pretty
Script.script:
function stat_tracker.make_time_pretty(elapsed_seconds) local hours = math.floor(elapsed_seconds / 3600) local minutes = math.floor((elapsed_seconds - hours * 3600) / 60) local seconds = math.floor(elapsed_seconds - hours * 3600 - minutes * 60)
--if minutes < 10 then -- minutes = "0" .. minutes --end
--if seconds < 10 then -- seconds = "0" .. seconds --end
return hours .. "h" .. minutes .. "m" .. seconds .. "s" end

Script.name: calculate_stats
Script.script:
function stat_tracker.calculate_stats() local current_time = time_get_time()
local elapsed_seconds = current_time - stat_tracker.start_time local elapsed_minutes = elapsed_seconds / 60 local elapsed_hours = elapsed_seconds / 3600
local xp_per_minute = math.floor(stat_tracker.session_xp / elapsed_minutes) local tp_per_minute = math.floor(stat_tracker.session_tp / elapsed_minutes)
local xp_per_hour = math.floor(stat_tracker.session_xp / elapsed_hours) local tp_per_hour = math.floor(stat_tracker.session_tp / elapsed_hours)
local session_time = stat_tracker.make_time_pretty(elapsed_seconds)
local result = { ["session_time"] = session_time, ["session_xp"] = stat_tracker.session_xp, ["session_tp"] = stat_tracker.session_tp, ["xp_per_minute"] = xp_per_minute, ["tp_per_minute"] = tp_per_minute, ["xp_per_hour"] = xp_per_hour, ["tp_per_hour"] = tp_per_hour }
return result end

function WordsAmount(inputstr, sep) if sep == nil then sep = "%s" end local t={} ; i=0 for str in string.gmatch(inputstr, "([^"..sep.."]+)") do i = i + 1 t[i] = str
end return i end

Script.name: get_time
convert_seconds_to_hms
Script.script:
function time.convert_seconds_to_hms(time_as_seconds) -- Hours part local hours = math.floor(time_as_seconds / 3600)
-- Minutes part local time_wo_hours = time_as_seconds - hours * 3600 local minutes = math.floor(time_wo_hours / 60)
-- Seconds part local seconds = time_wo_hours - minutes * 60
-- Buid result local result = ""
if hours ~= 0 then result = result .. hours .. "h" end
if minutes ~= 0 then result = result .. minutes .. "m" end
if seconds ~= 0 then result = result .. seconds .. "s" end
if result == "" then result = "now" end
return result end

Script.name: CopyString
Script.script: --python-gtk2 function CopyString(StirngThetIWantToCopyPaste) local rk_line={} local folder="/tmp/" local filename="00" local fileext=".py" local file = io.open(folder..filename..fileext, "w") rk_line[1]="#!/usr/bin/python" rk_line[2]="import gtk" rk_line[3]="clipboard = gtk.clipboard_get()" rk_line[4]="clipboard.set_text(\'"..StirngThetIWantToCopyPaste.."\')" rk_line[5]="clipboard.store()" for i=1,5 do file:write(rk_line[i].."\n") end file:close() os.execute('chmod 755 '..folder..filename..fileext) os.execute('python '..folder..filename..fileext) os.execute('rm '..folder..filename..fileext) end

Script.name: NewScript

--python-gtk2 function CopyString(StirngThetIWantToCopyPaste) local rk_line={} local folder="/tmp/" local filename="00" local fileext=".py" local file = io.open(folder..filename..fileext, "w") rk_line[1]="#!/usr/bin/python" rk_line[2]="import clipboard" rk_line[3]="clipboard.copy("..StirngThetIWantToCopyPaste..")" --rk_line[4]="clipboard.set_text(\'"clipboard.copy("abc")"\')" --rk_line[4]="text = clipboard.paste()" for i=1,3 do file:write(rk_line[i].."\n") end file:close() os.execute('chmod 755 '..folder..filename..fileext) os.execute('python '..folder..filename..fileext) os.execute('rm '..folder..filename..fileext) end
--pyperclip.copy('The text to be copied to the clipboard.') --spam = pyperclip.paste()

Script.name: DKunlocks
Script.script:
function DKunlocks(sep) --t0 = 1511777931 local tc = os.time()
local prefix = "am"
--local p = 34560 -- 9h36m period --local tc = os.time() -- current time --local tn=t0+p*(math.floor(os.difftime(tc,t0)/p)+1) --tn=t0+p*n local tn = AddPeriods(tc,t0,1) local OpensAt = tostring(os.date('%H:%M',tn)) if tn-1500>=tc then tn = tn-1500 OpensAt = tostring(os.date('%H:%M',tn)).." "..OpensAt if tn - 1500>=tc then tn = tn-1500 OpensAt = tostring(os.date('%H:%M',tn)).." "..OpensAt end end local OpensIn = time.convert_seconds_to_hms(os.difftime(tn,tc),0)
if sep == "" then cecho("<cyan>........ DK unlocks in "..OpensIn.." at "..OpensAt.." CEST.".."\n") elseif sep == " " then cecho("<cyan>........ DK unlocks in "..OpensIn.." at "..OpensAt.." CEST. ".."\n") elseif sep == "s" then send("emote says: DK unlocks in "..OpensIn.." at "..OpensAt.." CEST.".."") else send("tell"..sep.." DK unlocks in "..OpensIn.." at "..OpensAt.." CEST.".."") end
end

Script.name: ttf
Script.script:
------------------------------------------------- -- Put your Lua functions here. -- -- -- -- Note that you can also use external Scripts -- ------------------------------------------------- function ttf(period) local tc = os.time()
-- 7 pm moonrise time t0 local tnotseven=math.floor((tc-t0)/p) local tseven = t0+p*math.floor((tc-t0)/p) --new time difference local tdiff = (tc - tseven) -- how many 25ers passed after moonrise local ttf = math.floor((tc - tseven) / 1500) --add some time local tsome = ttf % 24-- + 20 -- [0;4;23] return ttf end

Script.name: AddPeriods
Script.script: function AddPeriods(current,timeref,step) --timereference is usually t0, moonrise at 7pm --step 1 for next dk, step 0 for last dk --local tc = os.time() local tseve = timeref+p*(math.floor(os.difftime(current,timeref)/p)+step) return tseve end

Script.name: NewScript
Script.script: ------------------------------------------------- -- Put your Lua functions here. -- -- -- -- Note that you can also use external Scripts -- ------------------------------------------------- function bindattack(attact_type, number, victim) send(attact_type.." "..number.."."..victim) end

Key.name: NukeKey
Key.script:
send("cast "..castspeed..nuke..target)
DisableKey("QuakeKey") DisableKey("FireballKey") DisableKey("SprayKey") DisableKey("DispelEKey") DisableKey("BowSwitchKey") DisableKey("LightningBoltKey") DisableKey("BashKey") DisableKey("ShootKey") DisableKey("AxePriestLordAsteriskKey")

Key.name: FireballKey
Key.script: echo(" F I R E B A L L \n") nuke=" 'fireball' " enableTrigger("Detect XP Gain") enableTrigger("LootCoins")

Key.name: BhandsKey
Key.script: echo(" B U R N I N G H A N D S \n") nuke=" 'burning hands' " enableTrigger("Detect XP Gain") enableTrigger("LootCoins")

Key.name: LightningBoltKey
Key.script: echo(" L I G H T N I N G B O L T \n") nuke=" 'lightning bolt' " enableTrigger("Detect XP Gain") enableTrigger("LootCoins")

Key.name: HarmKey
Key.script: echo(" H A R M\n") nuke=" 'harm' " enableTrigger("Detect XP Gain") enableTrigger("LootCoins")

Key.name: AboutBodyKey
Key.script: if AboutBodyWear=="grey-cloak" then send("get ceremonial "..backpack..";wield ceremonial;put axe "..backpack..";rem staff;get shield "..backpack..";wear shield;put staff "..backpack) end send("get "..AboutBodyWear.." "..backpack..";remove "..AboutBodyRemove..";wear "..AboutBodyWear..";put "..AboutBodyRemove.." "..backpack)

Key.name: New Key F5
Key.script: --send(key_f5[CharacterName]) --echotest(key_f5[CharacterName]) if CharacterName == "Strori" then send(WearAsShield) elseif CharacterName == "Vidgri" then send(WearAsShield) else send(Draw) end

Key.name: xp-key
Key.script:
enableTrigger("Detect XP Gain") enableTrigger("LootCoins")
xpOn= 1
ok = 0 if xpOn==1 then --{#showme XP report OFF.; xpOn = 0 ok = 1 if ok==0 then --{#showme XP report ON.; xpOn = 1 end end
